info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN COLUMBIANA... NORTHWESTERN BEAVER AND SOUTHWESTERN LAWRENCE COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Salem, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Salem, Beaver Falls, Columbiana, East Palestine, Ellwood City, New Brighton, Ohioville, Lisbon, Leetonia, New Waterford, Patterson Township, and Big Beaver. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 20 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
